value.title: Model data in Power BI
value.excerpt: Connect Power BI to multiple data sources to create reports. Define the relationship between your data sources.

value.title: Optimize a model forÂ performanceÂ in Power BIÂ
value.excerpt: Data Analysis eXpression (DAX) language is a key feature of Power BI. It is used to create calculated columns, calculated tables, and measures. In this module, you will learn how to use DAX to solve typical analytics problems. You will learn about one of the most popular DAX functions, CALCULATE, and how it can override the default behavior of Power BI.

value.title: Use visuals in Power BI
value.excerpt: Create and customize visuals to present data in compelling and insightful ways.

value.title: Work with Power BI visuals
value.excerpt: Learn how to choose from the exceptional visuals that Power BI makes available to you. Formatting visuals will direct the userâ€™s attention to exactly where you want it, while helping to make the visual easier to read and interpret. You will also learn about how to use key performance indicators (KPIs).

value.title: Avoid refresh errors when importing files in Power BI
value.excerpt: Have you refreshed Power BI files and got errors due to missing columns or unwanted columns? Here I show you how to avoid new columns for getting added and refresh error from missing columns.  I learnt this by watching Microsoft Power BI webinar with Chris Webb: https://info.microsoft.com/CO-PowerBI-WBNR-FY16-06Jun-21-Amazing-Things-with-Power-BI-Registration.html?Is=Website

value.title: Concatenate/ Merge columns with Power Query, the right way.
